android.name: Cotton Swabs
android.content: Using a ratio of 1 part vinegar to 3 parts water, dip a cotton ball into vinegar and apply it directly to the acne affected areas. Leave on for at least 10 minutes, or overnight.

android.name: Honey
android.content: Mix 2 tablespoons of honey and 1 teaspoon of cinnamon together until they are thoroughly blended and have formed a sort of paste.Apply the mask to your face (or spot treat) and leave on for 10-15 minutes.Rinse off completely.

android.name: Egg Whites
android.content: Separate the whites from the yolks of two eggs.You can use as many as you like, but normally 2 to 3 is enough.Whisk the whites until they're frothy, and let them sit for a few minutes.Allow the mask to sit and dry for about 20 minutes before rinsing off completely with warm water.

android.name: Orange Peels
android.content: Grind/pound up your orange peels and add a little water to create a paste, apply it to your face and/or problem areas.Wait for 20-25 minutes.

android.name: Banana Peels
android.content: Peel a banana.Take the peel, and rub the peel over acne very carefully. Let it sit for at least 30 minutes before rinsing it off.

android.name: Steam
android.content: Boil a pot of water, pour into a large bowl, and let it cool for a few minutes.After its temperature has lowered slightly, place your face above the bowl, and drape the towel over your head to trap the steam.After 10-15 minutes, remove the towel and pat your face dry.

android.name: Garlic
android.content: Either extract the garlic juice and mix it with 1 teaspoons or so of water, or mash up 2-3 cloves and let sit in water for about 10 minutes.Using a cotton pad, soak up the juice or garlic water and cover problem spots.
